section.title: Configuration Files
section.para: Webtemplate uses a number of configuration files to operate. Some of these files are mainted by the developer of the application whilst others are generated by install.php.
The majority of these files are located in the config directory.
These files are explained in the sections below.

section.title: Smarty Template Configuration File
section.para: The SMARTY template configuration file is located in the config directory. It is the only configuration file that is maintained by the application developer. There is one SMARTY template configuration file for each of the language supported by the application.

The configuration files follow a specific naming convention to allow the application to choose the correct file. The file name is in the format "language.conf" (eg en.conf for english and fr.conf for french). The langauage is identified using the "accept-language" header sent by the user's browser. The values themselves are defined in BCP 47.
The contents of the en.conf file, excluding the licence block, are shown below:
section.programlisting:
## global variables application_name = "Web Database Skeleton" application_version = "0.5.0+" Author = "Sandy McNeil" Language = "en"
## Session configuration sessionname = "webdatabase" gc_probabilty = 1 gc_divisor = 100 lifetime = 168
section.para: The "Global Variables" section contain the Application Name, Version and Author. They should be updated to refelect you application's information. This section also includes the Language that the userr has requested. This is used to define which set of templates to use, if they exist for that language and which translations to use for the php derived messages.

The "Session Configuration" section contains the information the application is to use to manage user sessions. Apart from the sessionname it is recommended that you do not edit any other variables in this section. The sessionname variable is used to identify wentemplate cookies and should be edited to reflect the name of your application.

The "gc_probability" and "gc_divisor" are used to decide if the application is to do garbage collection on the logindata and tokens database tables in order to delete stale entries. Entries in the loginsata table are deleted if they have not been accessed within the time specified in the lifetime variable. The lifetime variable is in hours and the default value og 168 hors is 7 days.

section.title: Local Config
section.para: The file local.conf contains the information for connecting the application to the database. The file is created from information the user who is installing the application enters in config.php. local.conf is created when the user runs install.php. There should be no need to manually edit this file.

note.para: The files config.php and local,conf are not stored in a directory that is servable by the webserver.

section.para: Example contents for local.conf are shown below:
section.programlisting: [database] phptype = pgsql hostspec = testhost database = testdatabase username = testuser password = testpassword

section.title: Parameters
section.para: The parameters.json is created and updated by the user when they run install.php. The file contains the key configuration parameters used by the application. They can be updated by an administror using the web interface. There should be no need to manually edit this file

section.title: Preferences
section.para: The preferences.json is created and updated by the user when they run install.php. The file contains the user preferences used by the application. They can be updated by an administror using the web interface. There is no need to manually edit this file.
